meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be erased.
meanings.sent1: The erasabilities of the whiteboard make it easy to correct mistakes.
meanings.sent2: Pencil marks have great erasabilities, allowing for changes to be made effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The erasabilities of the chalk on the sidewalk led to a fun game of hopscotch.
meanings.sent4: Her memory had erasabilities like a fading dream, making it hard to hold onto details.
meanings.sent5: The erasabilities of the sand on the beach were evident as the waves washed away footprints.

meanings.sent1: The erasabilities of the whiteboard are essential for classroom learning.
meanings.sent2: Ink lacks the erasabilities of pencil, making it harder to correct errors.
meanings.sent3: The erasabilities of the marker on the whiteboard made for a hilarious mix-up in the meeting notes.
meanings.sent4: His promises had erasabilities, disappearing as quickly as they were made.
meanings.sent5: The erasabilities of the snow on the ground allowed for a fresh start after each snowfall.
